note.p: Education: St Peter's School, York; Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge; St George's Hospital, London. MA; MB (1860 Cambridge), MD (1868, Cambridge)

Career: Practised as a Physician, in Leeds (1862-1889); Physician, Royal Infirmary, Leeds (1864-1884); Commissioner in Lunacy (1889); Regius Professor of Physic, Cambridge University (1892-his death); Privy Councillor (1920)
References: Alexander G Bearn, 'Fading icon', review of Michael Bliss, 'William Osler: a life in medicine' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 268-271
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1927 vol 101 pp xx-xxii, plate, signed by J R B
